Sample random addresses

Source: R/sample.R
sample.Rd

sample_ipv4() and sample_ipv6() sample from the entire address space; sample_network() samples from a specific network.

Usage

sample_ipv4(size, ..., replace = FALSE)

sample_ipv6(size, ..., replace = FALSE)

sample_network(x, size, ..., replace = FALSE)

Arguments

size

Integer specifying the number of addresses to return

...

These dots are for future extensions and must be empty.

replace

Should sampling be with replacement? (default: FALSE)

x

An ip_network scalar

Value

An ip_address vector

See also

Use seq.ip_network() to generate all addresses in a network.

Examples

sample_ipv4(5)
#> <ip_address[5]>
#> [1] 31.157.240.123 54.242.194.51  29.208.95.19   8.104.164.92   176.32.78.86  

sample_ipv6(5)
#> <ip_address[5]>
#> [1] 522a:6a33:cdbf:cea2:3360:3c23:eded:5e99
#> [2] 4f5c:c7da:bfeb:f2a4:7448:5cbc:2445:f2e1
#> [3] 8986:87ff:1328:18c7:32e8:738f:cd34:d648
#> [4] 7090:a97b:1b37:c7a8:7fb7:7031:28ce:c4a3
#> [5] a7b4:6255:afec:86f3:7950:4edd:b0a2:594f

sample_network(ip_network("192.168.0.0/16"), 5)
#> <ip_address[5]>
#> [1] 192.168.90.144  192.168.210.64  192.168.110.162 192.168.185.235
#> [5] 192.168.233.47 

sample_network(ip_network("2001:db8::/48"), 5)
#> <ip_address[5]>
#> [1] 2001:db8:0:77f9:1022:8cc:8d7e:3a41  2001:db8:0:2ffc:46e4:cda9:a31b:4eef
#> [3] 2001:db8:0:f2a0:de8d:32dd:5f55:f305 2001:db8:0:d2d3:63d6:ab9c:f194:6c64
#> [5] 2001:db8:0:167a:6507:48b7:85cf:f9cc
